title: How to Make a Cowboy Cake

steps.headline: Sandwich your two sponge cakes together using the jam.
steps.description: The sticky jam will help them stay together when you put them up on end.

steps.headline: Cut and shape the cake.
steps.description: Cut off one side of the cake so it can stand on end. Carve it into a triangle with curved sides. Trim the edges to make a cone shape. Trim the off cuts into a triangular slice, and position this end against the sides of the larger cake to enhance the shape of the cone.

steps.headline: Cover the whole construction with white buttercream.
steps.description: Use a palette knife to smooth it onto the cake.

steps.headline: Make the teepee.
steps.description: Stick five cocktail sticks into the top of the cake - these will be the poles supporting the teepee. Press a zig-zag line of chocolate buttons into the buttercream, all the way around the bottom of the cake. Repeat this pattern higher up as well.

steps.headline: Make the sand.
steps.description: Spread a thin layer of buttercream over the board around the cake. Using a spoon, sprinkle yellow sugar over the buttercream to create sand. Press some cowboy and Indian figures into the sand.

steps.headline: Finish the cake.
steps.description: Run a knife up the centre of the front panel, to give the impression of an entrance.

text: Sandwich your two sponge cakes together using the jam. The sticky jam will help them stay together when you put them up on end. Cut and shape the cake. Cut off one side of the cake so it can stand on end. Carve it into a triangle with curved sides. Trim the edges to make a cone shape. Trim the off cuts into a triangular slice, and position this end against the sides of the larger cake to enhance the shape of the cone. Cover the whole construction with white buttercream. Use a palette knife to smooth it onto the cake. Make the teepee. Stick five cocktail sticks into the top of the cake - these will be the poles supporting the teepee. Press a zig-zag line of chocolate buttons into the buttercream, all the way around the bottom of the cake. Repeat this pattern higher up as well. Make the sand. Spread a thin layer of buttercream over the board around the cake. Using a spoon, sprinkle yellow sugar over the buttercream to create sand. Press some cowboy and Indian figures into the sand. Finish the cake. Run a knife up the centre of the front panel, to give the impression of an entrance. Place on the table.
